Others: Portland Trail Blazers suffered a heavy 134-89 defeat to the Memphis Grizzlies on Sunday.
The Blazers had a dismal first quarter, shooting just 6-21 from the field and 1-10 from three-point range.
The Grizzlies shot an efficient 55.3% from the field and scored 58 points in the paint, emphasizing Portland’s defensive gaps.
The Trail Blazers started the season with solid energy and intensity, but that spark has seemed to disappear in recent games.
The players aren’t moving their feet or anticipating offensive or defensive plays, leaving them out of position and struggling to react.
The Blazers could be in for a challenging season if they continue to struggle.
